wikipedia_page.main: Sir Philip Edward Pilditch, 1st Baronet (12 August 1861 – 17 December 1948), was a British architect and Unionist politician.

response: The constituency's first MP was Philip Pilditch, an architect who piloted the Ancient Monuments Act 1931 through Parliament: see Scheduled Monument.  The MP for Spelthorne since 2010 is the author, columnist and historian Kwasi Kwarteng.

The Pilditch Baronetcy, of Bartropps in the County of Surrey, is a title in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom. It was created on 28 June 1929 for Philip Pilditch. He represented Spelthorne in the House of Commons as a Unionist. As of 2014 the title is held by his great-grandson, the fifth Baronet, who succeeded his father in 2012.
*Died: Philip Pilditch, 87, British architect and politician
